intro: Zigadenus monoecus, commonly known as the one-seed lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family and is characterized by its unique, single-seeded fruit. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
